Company: ENI S.p.A. and Snamprogetti Netherlands B.V.

Description: Snamprogetti Netherlands B.V. agreed to pay a $240 million criminal penalty to resolve Foreign Corrupt Practices Act charges that it participated in a decade-long scheme to bribe Nigerian government officials to obtain engineering, procurement and construction contracts.

Eni was ordered to pay a $440,000 civil penalty by the Alaska Oil and Gas Conservation Commission after finding that the company's well operations at Nikaitchuq had failed to be tested for mechanical integrity within the required four-year cycle.
Agency: Alaska Oil and Gas Conservation Commission

NAICS Translation: 211111: Crude Petroleum and Natural Gas Extraction
